definition: lit. as hurried as a shooting star (idiom); requiring immediate action/extremely urgent
urgent/pressing/rapid/hurried/worried/to make (sb) anxious
as/as if/such as
star/heavenly body/satellite/small amount
fire/urgent/ammunition/fiery or flaming/internal heat (Chinese medicine)/hot (popular)/classifier for military units (old)/Kangxi radical 86
surname Huo

sentences.english: Medical aid must be sent to the stricken area posthaste.
sentences.chinese: 灾区需用医药，急如星火。

definition: most urgent/posthaste/express
lit. the fire burns one's eyebrows (idiom); fig. desperate situation/extreme emergency
to burn with anxiety
extremely urgent
to need the toilet/urinary or defecatory urgency
variant of 倉促|仓促[cang1 cu4]
impatient/eager to/anxious to
to travel at double speed/to make all haste
to rush
inspiration in a moment of desperation (idiom)/also written 情急之下
to be in a state of emergency/to report an emergency/to ask for emergency assistance
to travel day and night
hastily/in a hurry
panic-stricken (idiom)/to be in a flustered state/also written 張惶失措|张惶失措[zhang1 huang2 shi1 cuo4]
to struggle to cope (with a situation)/to be at one's wits' end
to ponder a solution/to consider (the best move, how to find a way etc)
